item.title: CV/
item.description:
Please find below an abridged version of my CV. You can download a full PDF version from here.

George Pacheco

Evolutionary Biologist

Guest Researcher at the Centre for Ecological and Evolutionary Synthesis (CEES)

Blindernveien 31, 0371 Oslo ‚Ä¢ Norway

george.pacheco@ibv.uio.no
Initially trained in Biology in the Brazilian Northeast, I have worked on several projects in the vein of animal evolutionary genomics investigating a diverse range of taxa ‚Äî from tiny Collembolans to culturally evolving killer whales, which has given me a vast experience in the molecular lab and a fair understanding of the rationale behind bioinformatic analyses. During my scientific career, I have developed a profound interest in the genomic architecture controling the emergence and maintenance of cognitive traits, specially those implicated in spatial memory.

Academic Positions/

Technical Postdoc

Nov 2022 ‚Äî Oct 2025 | University of Oslo

item.title: George Pacheco, PhD
item.description:
George Pacheco, PhD

Guest Reseacher at the Centre for Ecological and Evolutionary Synthesis ‚Äî University of Oslo

Blindernveien 31, 0371 Oslo ‚Ä¢ Norway

The best way of getting a hold of me is through my institutional email: george.pacheco@ibv.uio.no.

Please write to me through it and I will get back to you as soon as possible.

item.title: News/
item.description:
11 Sep 2025/ I am happy that I submitted yesterday my Full Application to the 2025 call Grant for International Researchers announced by the S√£o Paulo Research Foundation presenting a project revolving around the evolution of the molecular and neuronal bases of general and specialised cognition in birds. This project was concieved to be hosted by the Departamento de Gen√©tica e Biologia Evolutiva ‚Äî Instituto de Bioci√™ncias at the University of S√£o Paulo in close collaboration with the Brain Institute at the my alma mater, the Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte. This is my attemp to go back to Brazil after almost 14 years of academic experience in Scandinavia. Fingers crossed! üáßüá∑ üê¶ üß†
22 Nov 2024/ Having conceived the idea for the foundation of a Society solely devoted to the realm of Evolutionary Biology in Brazil at the beginning of 2022 inspired by reading Andrea Wulf‚Äôs biography of Humboldt, it gives me immense pleasure that the very first congress (SBBE24) of the recently-established Brazilian Society for Evolutionary Biology (SBBE) successfully took place in Curitiba ‚Äî Paran√° from the 20th to the 22nd of November of 2024. Although fully remote, my participation in the foundation of the Society and organisation of its first event was a rather enriching experience to me. Many kudos to the incumbent SBBE Board and SBBE24 Local Committee ‚Äî truly Humboldtian feats! üëè I warmly wish the Society long-lasting prosperity, and I am already looking forward to attending its next event. üáßüá∑ üí¨ ‚è≠Ô∏è
13 Nov 2024/ I am glad to report that Hom√®re Monteiro¬¥s article is now published in Molecular Ecology. It was lovely to interect with Hom√®re during my time as a post-doc in üá©üá∞, and it is wonderful to see this resulting paper now out. üåä ü¶™ üß¨
08 Jul 2024/ I am back to Oslo to enjoy the Scandinavian summer! I really enjoyed my time visiting the lab of Prof. Kitano at NIG, sampling & touristing in Japan, but I am also happy to be back to Norway! üá≥üá¥ üå°Ô∏è üèñÔ∏è
23 Mar 2024/ After my well-deserved time in Brazil visiting family & attending a national conference, I am finally back to Norway. I returned already going to Bod√∏ to serve as a lecturer in the 2024 PhD Course in Population Genomics at the Nord University but I am now back to Oslo and looking forward to resuming my postdoctoral activities.
19 Mar 2024/ Together with two other young researchers, it is great that I was awared a NIG-JOINT (A) grant. The value of this small grant is 150.000 Yen (~ 10.700 NOK), and it will help facilitating our upcoming sparrow sampling in Japan during May ‚Äî June later this year. üáØüáµ üå∏ üê¶
03 Feb 2024/ I am very glad to be going to Brazil tomorrow for some holidays! During my 40 days in the South ‚Äî beside a well-deserved time with my family & friends ‚Äî I will be participating in the XXXV Brazilian Congress on Zoology. I am looking forward to taking advantage of this opportunity to expand my Brazilian Evolutionary Biology network. Finally, during my time there I will be working on the advancement of the procedures for the establishment of the Brazilian Society for Evolutionary Biology. üçπ üêö ‚òÄÔ∏è
09 Jan 2024/ First post of 2024! I am happy to share that I will be a lecturer in the 2024 PhD Course in Population Genomics at the Nord University in the beautiful region of Bod√∏. I am sure this will be a great opportunity for me to spread the knowledge I have acquired within the field of Evolutionary Genomics. üí¨ üßä üåå
18 Dec 2023/ I got the great news today that I was awarded the UiO:Life Science Internationalisation Support to help me with my fieldwork to collect tree sparrows & visit the lab of Prof. Kitano in Japan next year. I am really looking forward to this field season and to all new collabarations I will be involved with. üáØüáµ üå∏ üá≥üá¥
11 Nov 2023/ I am pleased to inform that one more article coming out from my time in Copenhagen is now published in Molecular Biology and Evolution. I had the initial idea for this project and collected its preliminary data. Then, it was transferred to Germ√°n Hern√°ndez-Alonso, who lead and greatly expanded this project as part of his PhD.
05 Nov 2023/ I am very happy to communicate that I was awarded the SMBE Interdisciplinary & Regional Meetings Grant together with five other Brazilian colleagues. This grant will not only help us to create the Brazilian Society for Evolutionary Biology, but also hold an inaugural congress where the newly created society will be made known. More about it soon!
11 Oct 2023/ I gave a small presentation at the The Annual CEES Student Conference 2023 about the progress of my post-doc at CEES. I presented very incipient results but I will sure that I will have much more to say during the conference to be held next year ‚Äî so stay tuned! üí¨ üìä üê¶
26 Sep 2023/ I am happy to say that my last collaboration with Mikkel Skovrind is finally out in Fisheries Research. This goes way back, has to do with Perch in the Baltic Sea & you can read it here. üêü üåä üé£
28 Jul 2023/ I am glad to announce that I just affiliated myself to the Sociedade Brasileira de Ornitologia üêß ü¶ú üê¶. After being outside Brazil for so many years, I do want now to start expanding my network there. Thus, this affiliation is also in preparation for my participation in the XXXV Brazilian Congress on Zoology that will be held in the beautiful Porto de Galinhas by the end of February next year. I am looking forward to finding myself discussing Avian Biology with Brazilian scholars in the vicinity of my hometown! üåû üåä üèñÔ∏è
16 Jul 2023/ After being in the Chokpak region (Kazakhstan) helping in the sampling live sparrows, I spent a few days visiting the Avian Section of the British Natural Museum in Tring to study their sparrow collection. I am now back to Oslo where I have started to analyse our incipient genomic data. It is great to be in Scandinavia during the remaining summer period. Nonetheless, the winter is coming ‚Äî and I am inevitably reminded of seeds and their locations. ü•∂ üå®Ô∏è ‚õÑ I should stop conversing with the old wizard from the South.
16 Mar 2023/ Once again I participated in the courses on Introductory Evolutionary Biology taught by Prof. Rosemberg Menezes to the programmes in Agronomy & Veterinary Medicine at the Federal University of Para√≠ba in Brazil. After my short lecture to each class on general concepts in Evolutionary Genomics, we had a lively discussion on the topic of Evoltuion and its clear implications to these derived fields. üè• üåæ
08-10 Feb 2023/ During this week, I attended my very first conference in Norway: Norwegian Biodiversity & Genomics Conference. It was a great pleasure to network with both local and international peers working on Genomics. Reflecting upon everything that was discussed, I am left with the impression that the current state of the field with so many consortia and a sheer amount of data being generated is similar to that of the Hubble Deep Field ‚Äî we do not really know what this exposure will reveal, but it is still worth collectiong the data. üìä üìà üó£Ô∏è
01-02 Nov 2022/ After a nice 17-hour boat trip between Copenhagen and Oslo where I learnt a little bit about the History of alcohol, I have now officially started a new position at CEES. I really hope that I will have a great time here taking the opportunity to explore the Norwegian Nature during the months to come! üèîÔ∏è ü•æ ‚õ∫
27-28 Oct 2022/ Today and tomorrow I will be at CEES participating in the kick-off meeting of our Sparrow Genomics project. I am looking forward to discuss together with my peers ideas regarding the evolution of these ubiquitous little feathered dinosaurs. ü§ì üìö
12-13 Oct 2022/ I went to Oslo for the very first time to participate in the The Annual CEES Student Conference. I really liked the structure of the conference because it was devoted to MSc and PhD students providing thus the young generation with a great opportunity to present their work. It was also nice to visit Oslo and I am looking forward to the commencement of my 3-year post-doc position at CEES where I will be working on Sparrow Genomics. üê¶ üß¨ üíª
15 Sep 2022/ One more article coming from my friend and colleague Waldir Miron is out. üê† üß¨
31 Aug 2022/ My collaboration with Waldir Miron bears one more fruit: new article on the phylogenomic relationships of Kryptolebias. üêü üß¨
24 Aug 2022/ Later today I will be going to Kristiansand ‚Äî ¬°it will be my first time in Norway! ‚Äî to attent the Final MarGen II Meeting. I am looking forward to meeting everyone a last time, and to hearing about the developments of all the other projects as well as presenting my own advancements. ü§ì üíª
17 Jun 2022/ I finished reading Why Evolution is True by Jerry A. Coyne. A couple os weeks ago I also finished reading What Evolution Is by Ernst Mayr, so it was a good opportunity to compare these two books directly. I will now read some Literature, but soon I will be back to my studies on Evolutionary Biology. üìö ü§ì
24 May 2022/ This week I am at by the Adriatic Sea in Italy together with the Sparrow Group. Our intention is to catch and release many birds. The data produced out of this sampling effort will eventually be used my many researchers inclusing myself as a post-doc at the Centre for Ecological and Evolutionary Synthesis at the University of Oslo in Norway. So I hope we will be seeing loads of birds in our nets!
28 Apr 2022/ Since yesterday I have been attending the MarGen II Meeting held at the Danish Shellfish Centre ‚Äî DTU Aqua in Nyk√∏bing Mors, Denmark. I has been great to hear the updates on all the projects. ü¶™ ü¶Ä ü¶û I also presented a quick update on our Baltic Sea Genomics project. The weather has been amazing! üòé
25 Apr 2022/ After being in the Northeast of Brazil for a whole amazing month on holidays, I am now back to work in Silkeborg. I have 6 months left to finalise our projects on fish üêü üê† üê° before I move to Oslo by the end of October. Work, work, work it is! ü§ì
01 Mar 2022/ I am glad to announce that I have accepted an offer to do a three-year post-doc together with Prof. Glenn-Peter S√¶tre, Assist. Prof. Mark Ravinet & Dr. Melissah Rowe. I will be based at the Centre for Ecological and Evolutionary Synthesis at the University of Oslo in Norway. Leveraging large-scale genomic data, we will be investigating several aspects of the House Sparrow evolution. I am very excited to go back to the field of Avian Genomics üêß ü¶ú üê¶, and also to move to a new country after more than 10 years living in Denmark üôÉ ‚Äî the intended starting date is the 1st of September 2022.
16 Nov 2021/ I am already in Gothenburg, Sweden to attend the Pangenomes: Evolution and Computation Meeting to be held tomorrow at the Conference Centre Wallenberg ‚Äî University of Gothenburg. I am very much looking forward to hearing from the experts in pangenomics about the advancements in this interesting front of modern Biology.
27 Oct 2021/ For the next 2 days I will be attending the MarGen II Annual Meeting held at the beautiful Tj√§rn√∂ Marina Laboratorium in Sweden. It is my first time outside Denmark in almost 2 years üò®, and I am excited to share the incipient results coming from our Baltic Sea Genomics project.
07 Oct 2021/ Another collaborative article of mine was accepted today to be published by the International Journal of Avian Science.
23 Sep 2021/ I had a brief participation in the courses on Introductory Evolutionary Biology taught by Prof. Rosemberg Menezes to the programmes in Agronomy & Veterinary Medicine at the Federal University of Para√≠ba in Brazil. I gave a short lecture to each class on general concepts in Evolutionary Genomics, and discoursed upon my career in this field so far.
22 Sep 2021/ Waldir's article was accepted and will be soon published by Genes. Congratulations, Waldir!
15 Sep 2021/ I gave a mini-workshop this morning on how Git & GitHub can should be used in Science. You can see the short tutorial we used here. #OpenScience!
17 Aug 2021/ I participated in the virtual MarGen II meeting since our in-person meeting was postponed to October ‚Äî looking forward to finally meeting everyone personally when the right time comes!
16 Aug 2021/ Waldir's article has now been submitted to Genes.
31 Jul 2021/ I officially launched this webpage ‚Äî welcome everyone!

item.title: Publications/
item.description:
Please find below an abridged version of my list of publication (please note that only the 3 first co-authors are displayed).

You can download a detailed PDF version from here.

In Preparation/

  • The Birth of the Brazilian Society for Evolutionary Biology (SBBE) ‚Äî Making Amends with History at Long Last.

    Pacheco

    , Torquato, Caron et al. To be submitted to the Evolution journal as a Commentary Article.

  • Insights into the Genomic Substrate of a Curious Sparrow.

    Pacheco

item.title: Reads/
item.description:
I read quite a few Science Communication books throughout my bachelor times in Natal. Undoubtedly, titles such as The Drunkard's Walk and Lonely Planets greatly contributed to my initial scientic education. Although I still very much harbour a desire to read on various scientific subjects (I really like Physics, for instance), at some point one must focus on a specific field considering the short half-life of a human begin. Thus, my reading of this kind of genre is no longer as diverse as it once was. Moreoever, by the end of my PhD in Copenhagen, I became rather interested in Literature, and I have been trying to catch up reading the Classics. Should you be curious to see which books I have read on these fronts, you are welcome to check my profile on goodreads. Having said that, what I present below is a list of titles revolving round the two subjects I intend to expertise, namely Evolutionary Biology & Philosophy of Science. The titles are presented in following their publication order within each category.

Classical Works/

Biographies/

Modern Works/

Philosophy & History of Science/

item.title: Research/
item.description:
So far in my scientific carrer I have mainly worked on projects in the vein of Animal Evolutionary Genomics. To some of these I chiefly collaborated with wetlab work, while to others my contribution was on the drylab front, and yet to other projects I wore both the wetlab and the drylab hats (that was certainly the case for those projected I led). You will find below a selected list of the projects I have participated alongside with a short explaination on how I contributed to each of them. Please notice that the order used here is arbritary, and hence does not reflect the projects' importances.

10K Bird Project/

Ongoing but no longer with my contributions
